questions: Q. 1. Mention any one feature of the oldest japanese book. [Board Term 1, 2015, Set-6AP67LB]
answers: Ans.		Oldest Japanese book contained six sheets of text and woodcut illustrations. (CBSE Marking Scheme, 2015) 1

questions: Q. 2. How were Biliotheque bleue different from penny chap books ? [Board Term 1, 2015, Set-C5JWEVD]
answers: Ans.		Both were low priced books printed on poor quality paper but the Biliotheque Bleue were bounded in cheap blue covers. (CBSE Marking Scheme, 2015) 1

questions: Q. 3. Name the first book printed by Johann Gutenberg.  [DDE-2015, Set-E)]
Q. 4. Give the ancient name of Tokyo.  [Board Term 1, 2015, Set-X0K2SB]
Q. 5. How did Louise Sebestian Mercier interpret the printing press ? [School of Yavatmal, 2015]
answers: Ans. He said that ‘printing press is the most powerful engine of progress and public opinion is the force that will sweep despotism away. 1

questions: Q. 6. Who developed the first printing press ?  [Board Term 1, 2014, (WQ7FXWC), (R9UJGYG)]
Q. 7. Which method of hand-printing was developed in China ? [Board Term 1, 2014, (X30T4XE)]
Q. 8. Why were cheap paperback editions of books print by the end of eighteenth century ?  [Board Term 1, DDE-2014]
answers: Ans. So that poor people could buy them. 1

questions: Q. 9. Who introduced hand-printing technology in Japan ? [Board Term 1, KVS-2014]
Q. 10. What is Calligraphy ? [Board Term 1, NCT-2014]
answers: Ans. The art of beautiful and stylish writing. 1    1 mark each

questions: Q. 11. By whom was the Ninety-five Theses written in 1517 ?

Q. 16. Who was Martin Luther ?

answers: Ans. So that the poor people can purchase them. 1
